result.execSummary:
The defendant Ira Lee Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- No contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crimes of domestic violence.

- Batterers Intervention program, or a course in Anger Management.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by court or agent.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ira Lee Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: To include a total of 6 days sentence credit on Count 2
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michelle Ackerman Havas, Br. 45, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit on count two.
Order for condition time signed on  12-11-2015 is a DUPLICATE for the 30 days imposed on 12-1-2015.  Order dated 12-11-2015 is VACATED.

Defendant Ira Lee Anderson not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
Count two  per Order for Commitment signed on 12/1/2015.
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (30 days straight time).
Offender in ABSCONDER status.  Review hearing cancelled.

Defendant Ira Lee Anderson in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for Jury Trial.  Parties have reached a resolution and are prepared to proceed with plea and sentencing.

As to Count 1  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.  
As to Counts 2 and 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.  Additional statements by victim. 

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to 90 days in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 months.

As to Count 3:  The court sentenced the defendant to 45 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 days time served, with Huber privileges for work and medical.  Court stays report date to 8-14-2015 by 12:00 pm.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Ira Lee Anderson in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  There is an outstanding 911 tape, per the State.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Janet A., no weapons and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Ira Lee Anderson in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-2-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Ira Lee Anderson in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Defense counsel needs the prior record of defendant from the State.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 2-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: JANET A.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ira Lee Anderson in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Defendant Ira Lee Anderson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Court Amends Complaint to Reflect Correct Name of Victim. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
